toolbar.hover.languages.markdownDescript: Languages support of the hover tooltip (when selecting text in the corresponding language editor, a tooltip will appear)
toolbar.panel.languages.markdownDescript: Languages support of the additional panel (will add a button to the right top of the corresponding language editor to open the additional panel)
toolbar.action.string.description: String that can be typed as a VSCode command or a predefined action name
toolbar.action.argument.regex.descriptio: Regular expression for matching selected text, where parentheses () can be used to capture remaining text
toolbar.action.argument.with.description: String for replacing selected text, where $1 ~ $9 are used to mark the positions of captured text
toolbar.action.replace.argument.descript: Parameters for the 'Replace Action', which can be a string, or a object with 'start', 'end', and 'self':{'regex', 'with'} attributes
toolbar.action.argument.start.descriptio: Add or delete string to the front of selected text
toolbar.action.argument.self.description: Processing of selected text, which can be a result string or a pattern matcher object with 'regex' and 'with' attributes
toolbar.action.argument.end.description: Add or delete string to the back of selected text
toolbar.action.replace.string.descriptio: Replace selected text with this string
toolbar.action.command.description: VSCode command specified for the 'Command Action'
toolbar.toolbox.name.description: Name of the toolbox, which will be displayed as the title
toolbar.toolboxs.layers.description: Toolbox layer, displayed as a row in the toolbox
toolbar.tool.icon.description: Icon name. Enter the name of an icon supported by https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels. If no suitable icon is found, enter a string starting with $ as the name, preferably not exceeding 3 letters
toolbar.tool.description.description: Introduction of the tool(s). When the mouse hovers over the tool(s), the introduction of the tool(s) will appear. If no introduction is provided, the name of the tool or tool layer will appear
toolbar.activate.description: Activation condition. It can be a boolean value or an object with properties 'languages' and 'hover'. If no activation condition is provided, it inherits the activation condition from the parent level
toolbar.activate.object.description: Activation condition object. The 'languages' property is required
toolbar.activate.languages.description: Activated when the opened text is in any of the specified languages
toolbar.activate.hover.description: Whether to display in a tooltip
toolbar.activate.boolean.description: When true, it follows the activation condition of the parent level; when false, it will be never activated
toolbar.tools.description: Tools, displayed as buttons in the toolbox layer
toolbar.actions.description: Actions of the tool, multiple actions can be executed sequentially for a tool
toolbar.toolbox.view.description: Display interface of the toolbox, which can only be one of the specific interfaces below. If an interface has multiple toolboxes, multiple toolboxes will share the same interface.
toolbar.builtin.markdown.activate.markdo: Whether to activate the built-in Markdown toolbox
toolbar.builtin.markdown.unorderListStyl: Set the style of the built-in Markdown toolbox's unordered list, optional values are `-`, `+` and `*`; default value is `+`
Set the style of the built-in Markdown toolbox's ordered list, optional values are `1)` and `1.`; default value is `1.`
toolbar.builtin.latex.activate.latexDesc: Whether to activate the built-in Latex toolbox
toolbar.description: Add custom buttons instead of commands. Markdown toolbar is built-in.
